name: E.A.R.L.'s Warehouse
description:
Special Announcement

Dehoarder 2 is in active development. In order to continue with my development plans, I need your support. Please Wishlist/Follow Dehoarder 2 on Steam today!

Enjoy my back catalog of free games (pay what you want, no third party ads, no in-app purchases). If you have fun with any of them, please consider supporting me on Patreon. ALL Patrons get access to my Daily Standup blog, and Beta Cat level or higher Patron will get automatic access to the earliest alpha playtest releases of Dehoarder 2.

Thank you for your support.

Keep Calm and Carry Boxes

Released in 2013 and visually not very sophisticated, this is one of my first games that was actually decent from a gameplay perspective. There are quite a few noodlers of block puzzles contained in this rough gem.

Something very strange is going on in E.A.R.L.’s Warehouse. E.A.R.L. awakens to find that the warehouse facility he works in has been abandoned. He needs your help to find an administrator and rid the warehouse facility of whatever sinister forces may have invaded.

As E.A.R.L., Move boxes to solve puzzles and overcome obstacles, and then make sure the boxes are shipped out in order to unlock the way forward.

Avoid robot-killing hazards like water, plasma beams, and electricity. Fire cannonballs to alter the layout of the level, allowing you to advance.

This puzzle game offers 36 levels plus 3 bonus levels, starting with simple levels to familiarize you with the puzzle mechanics, and advancing to complex levels requiring you to combine what you have learned in creative ways.

As this is a legacy project that has not been updated in some time, it is provided without warranty.
